</div><div>ğŸ‘‰Â Caesar CipherÂ </div><div>
</div><div>Summary: Implement a Caesar cipher, both encoding and decoding. The key is an integer from 1 to 25. This cipher rotates the letters of the alphabet (A to Z). The encoding replaces each letter with the 1st to 25th next letter in the alphabet (wrapping Z to A). So key 2 encrypts â€œHIâ€ to â€œJKâ€, but key 20 encrypts â€œHIâ€ to â€œBCâ€. This simple â€œmonoalphabetic substitution cipherâ€ provides almost no security, because an attacker who has the encoded message can either use frequency analysis to guess the key, or just try all 25 keys.Â </div><div>
</div><div>Source Code:Â Caesar cipher Project with Source CodeÂ Â </div><div>
